episodes.title: 37 - See in ADHD w/ Jeannie Friedman
episodes.summary:
Jeannie Friedman is an ADHD coach and the host of the podcast "See In ADHD."

As an ADHD Coach, Jeannie helps people understand their condition and how to use this knowledge to empower themselves.

Because ADHD presents itself so differently in everyone means they experience challenges, which are unique to them.

Overcoming obstacles is possible but it requires an individualized approach. There is no one-size-fits-all solution.

I really like Jeannie's approach and message and was excited to chat with her as I have struggled with ADHD throughout my life and know that it something a lot of Slackers out there deal with too.

Check out the show notes page for links to resources mentioned in the episode at SlackingAmbition.com/37.

Also, check out my appearance on Jennie's podcast "See In ADHD!"

Leave a 5-Star Rating and Review on iTunes.

Donate $1 per month on Patreon and help the show grow!

episodes.title: 36 - Face Your Fears and Trust the Unknown w/ Laurel Moll
episodes.summary:
Laurel Moll is a lifestyle writer, fitness teacher, and fellow truth seeker. She just published her second book called Following Fear: How I Faced 30 Fears and Learned to Trust the Unknown.

It's a memoir about how the curious events of the summer of 2013 inspired her to stop following my bliss and start following her fears. The group of intimate short stories share her journey of learning to trust everything that happens—the wins, the heartbreaks, the embarrassments, the deepest disappointments—and to find safety in the unknown.

Laurel and talk about how she left the security of being an employee and faced her fear of becoming a writer and starting her own fitness business.

Check out the show notes page at SlackingAmbition.com/36

 

Leave a Rating and Review on iTunes

episodes.title: 35 - Health, Social Media Marketing, and Podcasting w/ Orlando Rios
episodes.summary:
Orlando Rios is an online marketer, podcast host and producer.

Best known for his work with the health and fitness lifestyle brand Onnit, Orlando has extensive experience in helping companies increase their revenue through social and search advertising in Facebook, Adwords, Twitter, and Instagram.

He is also a leader in podcast producing and the author of The Podcast Book, the go-to guide on discovering your next favorite podcast and the who's who of podcasters.

The 2017 edition of The Podcast Book features over 600 recommended listings including the year's top picks, host, runtime, and frequency information. At 208 pages, it's the ultimate podcast guide!

Additionally, Orlando's site PodcastingPro.com gives free education on podcast producing and profiles of other leaders in the podcast industry.

Check out the show notes page at SlackingAmbition.com/35

Leave a 5 Star Rating and Review on iTunes

Donate on Patreon

episodes.title: 34 - Burn Fat Forever w/ Bruno da Gama
episodes.summary:
This week's episode is all about health as I talk to the Brazilian Health Nut himself, Bruno da Gama.

Bruno is the man when it comes to teaching others how to burn fat naturally and keep it off forever!

He is the host of the podcast "Burn Fat Forever" and has helped hundreds of people lose weight and keep it off.

Bruno has a 5 day 5 Pounds challenge that I have signed up for and have linked to below so that you can do it with me!

Just sign up here then head over to SlackingAmbition.com/facebook to join the private Facebook group and share how we do.

Resoures:

BrazilianHealthNut.com

5 Day 5 Pounds Challenge

Burn Fat Forever Podcast

@brazilianhealth

Donate on Patreon!

episodes.title: 33 - Get Your Content Seen w/ Bill Widmer
episodes.summary:
Bill Widmer is a content marketing consultant and freelance writer with over 4 years' experience with a B.S. in marketing and a minor in psychology from Penn State.

He's also big on outdoors and travel - he lived out of an RV for 4 months with his girlfriend and traveled the east coast.

Bill joins us to discuss how you too can make a living online, but to do it you have make sure that your content is getting seen. Fortunately, Bill is an expert at that and is here to help.

He also shares some of his procrastination and slacking stories with us.

Check out the show notes page at slackingambition.com/33

Support the show on Patreon

episodes.title: 32 - Change Careers the Smart Way w/ Alison Cardy
episodes.summary:
Alison Cardy of CardyCareerCoaching.com joins me this week to talk about how to approach a career change using her 4 proven career change strategies.

Make sure to check out the show notes page at SlackingAmbition.com/32

episodes.title: 31 - Britany Felix Returns!
episodes.summary:
Britany Felix returns to the show to tell us about how her life has changed in the last year and all of the awesome progress she has made!

Britany was the very first guest on Slacking Ambition and was in a very similar boat as I was when we first chatted in terms of just getting started in podcasting and entrepreneurialism.

Since then, she and her husband finished their cross country trip and have settled in Colorado.  Color me envious!

Britany has also started her own podcast production company where she edits and publishes shows for other podcasters allowing her to earn a living while pursuing her own show.  

It is a short but inspiring interview that PROVES that you can do anything you want with your life if you just stop slacking and start ACHIEVING!

episodes.title: 30 - Build Wealth Through Real Estate w/ Kathy Fettke
episodes.summary: Kathy Fetke is CEO of the Real Wealth Network, a California-based real estate investment club, where she helps normal people acquire high cash flow income properties so they  can retire early. Kathy went on to author the #1 best seller 'Retire Rich with Rentals'. She is frequently featured as a market timing expert on CNN, CNBC, NPR, FOX News, CBS MarketWatch and the Wall Street Journal.

episodes.title: 29 - Build Better Relationships w/ Jason Treu
episodes.summary:
Jason Treu is a leading expert on human behavior, daring leadership and relationship building. Author of the #1 bestselling book, Social Wealth, the how-to-guide on building personal and professional relationships, has sold more than 32,000 copies and has been #1 in four business and self-help categories.

Go to SlackingAmbition.com/29 to listen!

episodes.title: 28 - Health, Wealth, and Happiness w/ Joan Sotkin
episodes.summary:
Joan Sotkin is the host of the Prosperity Place podcast, an author, and a business coach who focuses on helping her clients build a life of happiness by creating a business that inspires them.

Her unique holistic approach emphasizes how your internal environment affects your external results.

Also, Joan has given you Slackers out there an incredible offer! The link in the resources below includes the coupon code Joan mentioned on show which is good for $25 off of her Financial Freedom course!

Check out the show notes page at SlackingAmbition.com/28!

episodes.title: 27 - Build a Profitable Vending Business w/ Matt Miller
episodes.summary:
Matt Miller is the founder of School Spirit Vending, a vending machine business that he has successfully franchised.

It all started with him being flat broke with one gumball machine! Today Matt has vending machines in over 2000 schools, across 32 States and will double his team size this year alone.

He teaches how others can use this method to create a passive income stream requiring little time!

Matt offers some great insight on how to overcome fear and doubt to start working towards building the life you want for yourself.

Check out the show notes page at SlackingAmbition.com/27

episodes.title: 26 - Don't Build It, BUY IT w/ Ace Chapman
episodes.summary:
Ace Chapman is a business flipping expert who also teaches others how to invest into profitable businesses and websites as a passive revenue source.  

His story is interesting...Ace was a flat broke, college drop-out who had an idea of putting up billboards all over the city that said "We Buy Ugly Houses".

That went onto be his first million dollar business and since then he has built a career as a consultant who helps others find and purchase the right business for them and build passive income. 

Check out the show notes page for links to all the resources mentioned on the show at SlackingAmbition.com/26

episodes.title: 25 - What's Your Crutch w/ Benjamin Tyler
episodes.summary:
Benjamin Tyler is a transformational speaker and creator of the Unleash Yourself Program. A program he has used to serve people around the world to better understand who they are, what they want, and how to go out and get it.

He is also host of An Evolving Lifestyle Podcast that focuses on individuals that are living life on their terms and continuing to grow in the process.

On this episode, Ben and I talk about how to live life as your best self and how eliminating mind altering substances from our lives can precipitate that effect.

Check out the show notes page at SlackingAmbition.com/25

episodes.title: 24 - Create Awesome Online Courses w/ Sid Bharath
episodes.summary:
Sid Bharath is my guest this week and joins me to talk about his experiences in the realm of content creation.

Sid is an entrepreneur, marketer, and VP of Growth at Thinkific, the all-in-one online course platform.

On this episode, I talk about online content creation and how the growth of online courses is an incredible opportunity for today's budding entrepreneurs.

He also talks about some of the struggles and setbacks he has faced throughout his journey towards success.

Check out the show notes page and a link to Sid's offer at SlackingAmbition.com/24

episodes.title: 23 - Solo Episode the Third
episodes.summary: This week I talk about how the show has been going and how excited I am that we are almost at 10K+ downloads for the month!

episodes.title: 22 - Purpose, Platform, Profit w/ Stephanie Mulac
episodes.summary:
This week I talk to Stephanie Mulac about how to live a life of purpose and convert it into a profitable platform on the internet. She also shares stories about her life living on the road in an RV.

Check out the show notes at SlackingAmbition.com/21

episodes.title: 21 - Real Talk w/ Ashley Taylor Yanello
episodes.summary:
This week I talk to Ashley Taylor Yanello of the podcast Real Talk with Ashley, High Vibe Like What about positivity and how it is essential to following your dreams and creating the life you want.

Ashley is a talented podcast host and public speaker who talks about her journey and how she is working hard to live the life she wants.

Ashley is also the creator of supportive courses to support you wherever you find yourself in life and blends spirituality, personal development and life lessons with a dash of no nonsense humor, and brutal honesty.

Ashley has a huge heart, is a ENFJ and loves authentically connecting with people all over the world!

Ashley believes energy is everything. She has been seen on Huffington Post, Mind Body Green, Cafe Truth, and Wild Sister to name a few.

This episode features adult language.

Check out the show page at slackingambition.com/21

episodes.title: 20 - Earn a Living as a Freelancer /w Ryan Waggoner
episodes.summary:
This week I talk to Ryan Waggoner about how to earn a full time living as a freelancer.

Ryan is longtime freelancer who currently runs RyanWaggoner.com where he shows aspiring entrepreneurs and freelancers how to make $250k+ per year!
Ryan also talks about some of the hurdles he has had to overcome while building his business as well as some of the challenges of transitioning from an employee to a freelancing independent contractor.

Check out the show notes page at SlackingAmbition.com/20

episodes.title: 19 - Practicing at the Game w/ RJ Hodges
episodes.summary:
Author and motivational speaker RJ Hodges joins me this week to talk about mastering the techniques necessary to developing and maintaining a mindset for success.

RJ is an accomplished public speaker and s a bestselling co-author of the book Mission Unstoppable partnering with world renowned leaders George Fraser and Les Brown.

He is also the author of You Can’t Practice At The Game, The Art of Mastering You Volume One and an audio book series called Winner Status.

RJ goes into how he was able to develop his talents into a coaching service and also tells us a little bit about his experiences with Reiki.

Check out the show notes page at SlackingAmbition.com/19

episodes.title: 18 - It IS All About the Money w/ Jillian Lama
episodes.summary:
Jilllian Lama talks to on the podcast this week about how important sales and marketing are to any business plan and how ultimately, it IS all about the money!

Jillian is a super talented person with a strong background in sales, marketing, and entrepreneurship and offer valuable insight into how get more business.

She also has some awesome insight and advice on how building real relationships with clients can lead to increased and more consistent revenue for your business.

Jillian currently offers her talents as a consultant to entrepreneurs looking to increase their revenue through higher level sales techniques.

Check out the show notes page at SlackingAmbition.com/18

episodes.title: 17 - Discover the Hustle w/ Brad Ploch
episodes.summary:
This week, I talk to Brad Ploch about hustling and how to take action towards accomplishing more things in life in the same amount of time.

Brad is the founder and editor at DiscoverTheHustle.com and one of the founders of Golf Shots novelty shot glasses all while being the VP of Product Development at ActiveEDU.

Oh yeah, did I mention that he is still a college student and only 21 years old?

Brad and I discuss how mastering time management is key to being able to balance multiple responsibilities while still making time for rest and relaxation.

Check out the show notes page at SlackingAmbition.com/17

Oh yeah, what do you think of the episode artwork? Let me know at SlackingAmbition.com/facebook!

episodes.title: 16 - Investing for Slackers w/ Chris Claflin
episodes.summary:
This week on the show, I'm talking to Chris Claflin about investing.

Investing is super scary due to the level of risk involved so Slackers tend to shy away from it, but Chris has been successfully investing as a full time source of income for over 5 years now and really breaks down how Slackers can start to benefit from it.

I really enjoyed talking to Chris not just for his voluminous knowledge of using money to make money, but also for the similar views we have on monetary policy and politics.

Chris is the host of Uncharted Podcast where he breaks down the markets and his journey as an entrepreneur. Check it out on iTunes and all other major podcast platforms or at his website UnchartedPodcast.com.

Check out the show notes page at SlackingAmbition.com/16

episodes.title: 15 - Solo Episode The Sequel!
episodes.summary:
On this episode, I fly solo yet again and talk about some of the amazing feedback I've been getting on the show. I also delve into some of the obstacles I'm striving to overcome as I continue my journey in podcasting, entrepreneurship, and fitness.

Check out the show notes page at SlackingAmbition.com/15

episodes.title: 14 - Be a Business Rockstar w/ Nicole Holland
episodes.summary:
I talk to Nicole Holland from the Building Business Rockstars podcast about what it takes to make it on your own. We also chat about how to overcome uncertainty and fear when leaving a career in favor of entrepreneurship.

Check out the show notes page at slackingambition.com/14

Disclaimer:  This one has some adult language

episodes.title: 13 - Solo Episode
12 - Tiny Leaps Big Changes w: Gregg Clunis
episodes.summary: This week, I speak to Gregg Clunis of the podcast Tiny Leaps Big Changes. Gregg launched his show at the beginning of the year and has already crossed 200K in downloads! Gregg gives his listeners inspiring content to help them make big changes in their

episodes.title: 11 - Afford Anything w/ Paula Pant
episodes.summary:
This week I talk to the founder of one of my favorite blogs, Paula Pant.

Paula is the founder of AffordAnything.com where she blogs about personal finance and investing with a focus on real estate.

I was super excited to be talking to her because I have been following her blog's newsletter for quite some time now and have always found it to be a great inspiration.

Before founding the blog, Paula quit her job to travel the world and learned that we truly can afford anything, we just can't afford everything. I really like that maxim!

Check out the show notes page at SlackingAmbition.com/11

episodes.title: 10 - Elevate Beyond with Jake Kelfer
episodes.summary:
Jake Kelfer and I sit down to talk about upping your game.

Jake is the author of the best selling book Elevate Beyond and really brought a lot to the table on this episode.

In Elevate Beyond, Jake provides strategies, tips, stories and resources to show how you can stand out in work and life.

Check out the show notes at SlackingAmbition.com/10

episodes.title: 09 - The World Wanderers Ryan Ferguson & Amanda Kingsmith
episodes.summary:
On this episode, I talk to Ryan Ferguson and Amanda Kingsmith of the World Wanderers Podcast.

Ryan and Amanda are awesome folks and I really enjoyed my chat with them.

Both of them left their traditional lifestyles and jobs behind and are living their lives on their own terms by traveling the world while podcasting and blogging about it.

Our conversation starts off focusing on travel but sort of veers into health and fitness towards the end.

Check out the show notes page for links to the resources mentioned in the show at SlakcingAmbition.com/09.

episodes.title: 08 - Nick DiNardo
episodes.summary:
Nick DiNardo of The Sweet Adversity Podcast and author of the book "The AdversityGame" joins me to talk about developing new skills through adversity.

Get 2 Free Chapters of his book at NickDiNardo.com/SlackingAmbition

episodes.title: 07 - Nicholas and Amanda Bayerle
episodes.summary:
On this episode of Slacking Ambition, I sit down with Nicholas and Amanda Bayerle of TheTrueChallenge.com.

This episode is focused on fitness as I believe that success and momentum are directly correlated to keeping fit.

The healthier you are, the more energy you have to devote to more things like a side hustle.  Low energy and feeling tired all the time contribute to procrastination heavily.

episodes.title: 06 - Steven Shalowitz
episodes.summary: Steven joins me on the show today to talk about creating your vision and putting yourself out there as well as about his travels and how they helped influence the concept of his show.

episodes.title: 05 - Zephan Moses Blaxberg
episodes.summary:
On this episode of Slacking Ambition, I speak with Zephan Moses Blaxberg.

Zephan is the host of the top rated podcast The Year of Purpose as well as the best selling author of the book Life Rescripted.

Zephan chats with me about he overcomes limiting beliefs and why he decided to take matters into his own hands and rescript his own life.

Zephan offers up some inspirational tidbits and useful resources!

 

SlackingAmbition.com/05

episodes.title: 04 - Dr. Valerie Young
episodes.summary:
On this episode of the show, I talk to Dr. Valerie Young about the 5 common career myths that are killing your dream.

These include thinking you need a j-o-b to make a living, focusing on skills not interests, thinking you need to pick just one passion/calling/interest, and the Life First-Work Second approach to career planning.

Dr. Young is the founder or ChangingCourse.com and ImposterSyndrome.com and had great stories about how she has helped people figure out how to make a living doing what they love and live a purpose filled life.

Check out her websites as well as her book The Secret Thoughts of Successful Women: Why Capable People Suffer from the Impostor Syndrome and How to Thrive in Spite of It.

episodes.title: 03 - Suresh Thakoor
episodes.summary:
On this episode, I interview Suresh Thakoor or the#BlissHacker Podcast.

Suresh talks about his experiences toward the launch of his podcast and website as well as what motivated him to start them.

Suresh also tells us about how the obstacles he has faced in his life have helped to shape who he is today.

Check out Suresh's website blisshacker.com and the #blisshacker podcast on iTunes.

episodes.title: 02 - Julie Zuzek
episodes.summary:
On this episode of the podcast, I talk to Julie Zuzek of The Conscious Business Podcast.

Julie and I had a great conversation about entrepreneurship as a form of personal development and the importance of wellness in our approach to our business and our personal life.

I really enjoyed talking to Julie and found her story of leaving the average lifestyle of having a job and defining identity by what do or how much money you make to making her way in this world and defining herself by her core values.

I also found it fascinating that she makes wellness practices like yoga and ayurvedic medicine into her approach.

Check out Julie's website at TheCorporateYogi.com.

 

http://www.slackingambition.com/podcast/episode-02-julie-zuzek

episodes.title: 01 - Britany Judd-Felix
episodes.summary: On this first episode of Slacking Ambition, Britany Judd-Felix joins us to talk about the ups and downs she has faced in life and the upcoming adventure she'll be taking.
